alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 4:33AM PST until November 22 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Ice accumulation around one tenth of an inch. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches along the Highway 2 corridor and up to 2 inches further south over the Columbia Basin. * WHERE...Wenatchee, Entiat, Chelan, Waterville, Odessa, Number 2 Canyon, Mansfield, Harrington, Grand Coulee, Othello, Ephrata, Leavenworth, Ritzville, Plain, Number 1 Canyon, Wilbur, Pangborn Airport, Moses Lake, Creston, Quincy, Cashmere, Badger Mountain Road, and Coulee City. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
